summary: The implementation successfully addresses all five requirements. Password-based authentication has been removed in favor of username-only login. The backend enforces that 'Alaie' is reserved for admin access only, preventing guests from using it. A conditional Display Name field appears on the login page when the username is 'Alaie', allowing admins to set their display name. The frontend displays the admin's display name in chat messages, profile, and conversation list with appropriate fallback to 'Alaie'. All acceptance criteria appear to be met based on the code changes.

hallucinated_features.description: Migration module (backend/migration.mo) was added to handle state upgrades
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest does not mention creating a migration module or handling data migration during authentication changes. While the constraint says 'Preserve existing message history and user profiles', this implies continuity, not the creation of a new migration system.

hallucinated_features.description: Username conflict detection for guests (username already taken error)
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest does not mention preventing duplicate usernames or handling username conflicts. It only specifies blocking 'Alaie' for guests, not general username uniqueness validation.
